qas.question: Who became responsible in part for the editing of The New Humanist?
What groups thoughts did he seek to include?
What was the name of the material that was produced from this groups and the opinions of others?
How many cornerstones of this new way of thinking or religion were presented>
Who became responsible for the stealing of The New Humanist?
What groups thoughts did he seek to exclude?
What was the name of the material that was destroyed by this group and the opinions of others?
What year was the Humanist Manifesto lost forever?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>Raymond B. Bragg<b4_0/>,<a0_0/> the associate editor of The New Humanist, sought to consolidate the input of Leon Milton Birkhead, Charles Francis Potter, and several members of the <a1_0><b5_0>Western Unitarian Conference<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Bragg asked Roy Wood Sellars to draft a document based on this information which resulted in the publication of the <a2_0><b6_0>Humanist Manifesto<b6_0/><a2_0/> in <b7_0>1933<b7_0/>. Potter's book and the Manifesto became the cornerstones of modern humanism, the latter declaring a new religion by saying, "any religion that can hope to be a synthesising and dynamic force for today must be shaped for the needs of this age. To establish such a religion is a major necessity of the present." It then presented <a3_0>15<a3_0/> theses of humanism as foundational principles for this new religion.
